articles.headline: Japan Looks to Its Savers to Consume
articles.snippet: Japan’s central bank is expected to take a momentous step by raising interest rates, effectively for the first time in almost two decades.
articles.abstract: Japan’s central bank is expected to take a momentous step by raising interest rates, effectively for the first time in almost two decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO, July 10 — As early as Friday, Japan’s central bank is expected to take a momentous step in the nation’s economic recovery by raising interest rates, effectively for the first time in almost two decades.

articles.headline: Explosion Kills Chechen Rebel Tied to Carnage
articles.snippet: Shamil Basayev claimed responsibility for some of Russia's worst terror attacks, including the Beslan school siege.
articles.abstract: Shamil Basayev claimed responsibility for some of Russia's worst terror attacks, including the Beslan school siege.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, July 10 — Shamil Basayev, the Chechen rebel who organized the deadliest terrorist attacks against Russia, was killed in an explosion early Monday, in what the director of the country’s security service described as a special operation that began by tracking shipments of weapons and explosives from abroad.

articles.headline: Pentagon Struggles With Cost Overruns and Delays
articles.snippet: Both parties are concerned that runaway costs at the Pentagon threaten to weaken the armed forces.
articles.abstract: Both parties are concerned that runaway costs at the Pentagon threaten to weaken the armed forces.

articles.headline: Meth Users, Attuned to Detail, Add Another Habit: ID Theft
articles.snippet: For law enforcement officials in Denver, meth users have become the everyday face of identity theft.
articles.abstract: For law enforcement officials in Denver, meth users have become the everyday face of identity theft.

articles.headline: China Posts a Surplus Sure to Stir U.S. Alarm
articles.snippet: Economists said that the huge imbalance raises the prospect of more tensions with the U.S. and Europe.
articles.abstract: Economists said that the huge imbalance raises the prospect of more tensions with the U.S. and Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, July 10 — China reported a record trade surplus with the rest of the world on Monday, one of the largest monthly trade imbalances any country has ever recorded and one that is likely to heighten trade tensions, particularly with the United States and Europe.

articles.headline: Paulson, Taking Treasury Post, Emphasizes Global Issues
articles.snippet: Henry M. Paulson Jr. will be leading a new economic team that has an early reputation as more pragmatic than ideological.
articles.abstract: Henry M. Paulson Jr. will be leading a new economic team that has an early reputation as more pragmatic than ideological.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 10 — Henry M. Paulson Jr. took over on Monday as Treasury secretary and as President Bush’s top economic adviser, filling out a new economic team with a more pragmatic cast for the final two and a half years of this administration.

articles.headline: Paulson, Taking Treasury Post, Emphasizes Global Issues
articles.snippet: Henry M. Paulson Jr. took over on Monday as Treasury secretary and as President Bush's top economic adviser, filling out a new economic team with a more pragmatic cast for the final two and a half years of this administration.     Mr. Bush, who wo...
articles.abstract: Henry M. Paulson Jr. took over on Monday as Treasury secretary and as President Bush's top economic adviser, filling out a new economic team with a more pragmatic cast for the final two and a half years of this administration.     Mr. Bush, who wooed Mr. Paulson from his post as chairman of Goldman Sachs, said on Monday that the former executive would have a central role in setting the agenda and implied that the Treasury Department would regain some of the power it lost to White House advisers during Mr. Bush's first term.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 10 - Henry M. Paulson Jr. took over on Monday as Treasury secretary and as President Bush's top economic adviser, filling out a new economic team with a more pragmatic cast for the final two and a half years of this administration.

articles.headline: Japan Looks to Its Savers to Consume
articles.snippet: As early as Friday, Japan's central bank is expected to take a momentous step in the nation's economic recovery by raising interest rates, effectively for the first time in almost two decades.     The move would send an important signal that Japan...
articles.abstract: As early as Friday, Japan's central bank is expected to take a momentous step in the nation's economic recovery by raising interest rates, effectively for the first time in almost two decades.     The move would send an important signal that Japan's economy, the world's second-largest after the United States, has finally emerged from a long bout of stagnant growth and falling prices. But paradoxically, economists say, the end of these ills brings a new challenge to Japanese consumers, who have not experienced a healthy economy since the 1980's.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO, July 10 - As early as Friday, Japan's central bank is expected to take a momentous step in the nation's economic recovery by raising interest rates, effectively for the first time in almost two decades.

articles.headline: China Posts a Surplus Sure to Stir U.S. Alarm
articles.snippet: China reported a record trade surplus with the rest of the world on Monday, one of the largest monthly trade imbalances any country has ever recorded and one that is likely to heighten trade tensions, particularly with the United States and Europe...
articles.abstract: China reported a record trade surplus with the rest of the world on Monday, one of the largest monthly trade imbalances any country has ever recorded and one that is likely to heighten trade tensions, particularly with the United States and Europe.     The government said that the surplus in June reached $14.5 billion, a record for the second month in a row, eclipsing each of the giant surpluses recorded by Japan in the last few decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, July 10 - China reported a record trade surplus with the rest of the world on Monday, one of the largest monthly trade imbalances any country has ever recorded and one that is likely to heighten trade tensions, particularly with the United States and Europe.

articles.headline: Pit Bull of the House Latches On to Immigration
articles.snippet: Representative F. James Sensenbrenner Jr. has no tolerance for illegal immigrants, either in his political life or personal life.     ''My housekeeper in Wisconsin was born in Wisconsin,'' says Mr. Sensenbrenner, the Republican congressman and cha...
articles.abstract: Representative F. James Sensenbrenner Jr. has no tolerance for illegal immigrants, either in his political life or personal life.     ''My housekeeper in Wisconsin was born in Wisconsin,'' says Mr. Sensenbrenner, the Republican congressman and chairman of the House Judiciary Committee. ''My housekeeper here is a naturalized U.S. citizen from Nicaragua.''
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 10 - Representative F. James Sensenbrenner Jr. has no tolerance for illegal immigrants, either in his political life or personal life.

articles.headline: Pentagon Struggles With Cost Overruns and Delays
articles.snippet: On Sept. 10, 2001, Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld stood before hundreds of military officers and civilian employees at the Pentagon and delivered a blistering attack on what he saw as the next national security threat: Pentagon bureaucracy. ...
articles.abstract: On Sept. 10, 2001, Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld stood before hundreds of military officers and civilian employees at the Pentagon and delivered a blistering attack on what he saw as the next national security threat: Pentagon bureaucracy.      He called for quicker decision-making, greater accountability and a streamlined process to get weapons into the hands of soldiers faster. ''We must transform the way the department works and what it works on,'' he said. ''It could be said that it's a matter of life and death -- ultimately, every American's.''

articles.headline: Explosion Kills Chechen Rebel Tied to Carnage
articles.snippet: Shamil Basayev, the Chechen rebel who organized the deadliest terrorist attacks against Russia, was killed in an explosion early Monday, in what the director of the country's security service described as a special operation that began by tracking...
articles.abstract: Shamil Basayev, the Chechen rebel who organized the deadliest terrorist attacks against Russia, was killed in an explosion early Monday, in what the director of the country's security service described as a special operation that began by tracking shipments of weapons and explosives from abroad.     President Vladimir V. Putin declared the death of the country's most wanted man -- who had a price of more than $10 million on his head -- in Ingushetia, a region on Chechnya's western border, a ''just retaliation'' for the bloodshed Mr. Basayev had caused.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, July 10 - Shamil Basayev, the Chechen rebel who organized the deadliest terrorist attacks against Russia, was killed in an explosion early Monday, in what the director of the country's security service described as a special operation that began by tracking shipments of weapons and explosives from abroad.

articles.headline: Stubborn Man Tries to Govern in Violent Iraq
articles.snippet: Mamoon Sami Rashid is the governor with 29 lives.     That's the number of assassination attempts he has counted since joining the Anbar provincial government in January 2005.
articles.abstract: Mamoon Sami Rashid is the governor with 29 lives.     That's the number of assassination attempts he has counted since joining the Anbar provincial government in January 2005.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMADI, Iraq, July 8 - Mamoon Sami Rashid is the governor with 29 lives.

articles.headline: Video Shows Soldiers' Bodies
articles.snippet: An Internet video posted by insurgents shows the mutilated bodies of two American soldiers abducted and killed in Iraq in June. Page A10.
articles.abstract: An Internet video posted by insurgents shows the mutilated bodies of two American soldiers abducted and killed in Iraq in June. Page A10.
articles.lead_paragraph: An Internet video posted by insurgents shows the mutilated bodies of two American soldiers abducted and killed in Iraq in June. Page A10.

articles.headline: Meth Users, Attuned to Detail, Add Another Habit: ID Theft
articles.snippet: Joe Morales, a prosecutor in Denver, can remember when crack came to his city in the 1980's. Gangs set up on Colfax Avenue and in the Five Points neighborhood, and street crime -- murders and holdups -- grew.     When methamphetamine proliferated ...
articles.abstract: Joe Morales, a prosecutor in Denver, can remember when crack came to his city in the 1980's. Gangs set up on Colfax Avenue and in the Five Points neighborhood, and street crime -- murders and holdups -- grew.     When methamphetamine proliferated more recently, the police and prosecutors at first did not associate it with a rise in other crimes. There were break-ins at mailboxes and people stealing documents from garbage, Mr. Morales said, but those were handled by different parts of the Police Department.
articles.lead_paragraph: Joe Morales, a prosecutor in Denver, can remember when crack came to his city in the 1980's. Gangs set up on Colfax Avenue and in the Five Points neighborhood, and street crime -- murders and holdups -- grew.
